intro: Languas mollis, commonly known as soft tongues, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Languas mollis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
